Title: GUCCI Client Advisor - Madrid Serrano
Description:
Summary

Job Description

Role Mission

To provide customers with top quality service by meeting their needs and expectations as well as to increase the brand loyalty by communicating as ‚ÄúGucci ambassador" the philosophy and the culture of the Brand.

Key Accountabilities


Serve customers accordingly with Gucci selling ceremony
Provide exceptional customer service experience by greeting, listening and assisting customers in exceeding their needs, demonstrating an excellent knowledge of the products as well as of Gucci history and heritage
Guarantee cross and up-selling for all product categories
Discuss with clients and give advice on general trends in fashion world and developments in luxury market, showing passion for fashion and luxury products
Build and strengthen relationships with customers, deal with different nationalities and personalities and put always the customers at ease
Ensure qualitative monitoring and updating of customer information, accordingly to the Company tools (CRM), in order to retain actual customers and detect new high potential ones
Ensure the achievement of individual and Store goals, enhancing and developing the business
Foster open and constructive communication with team members, being always collaborative and proposing effective solutions
Contribute to manage the visual display of the products in accordance with Gucci visual standards
Ensure store functional maintenance and appropriate levels of products on the sales floor, in line with Corporate policies and procedures
Ensure the products replenishment and physical inventory of merchandise
Follow Company grooming, accordingly with Gucci standards and policies


Key Requirements


Proven experience in a similar role within fashion retail companies
Proven ability to drive and exceed individual and store result
Deep passion for fashion and luxury
Excellent commercial awareness and customers attitude
High flexibility and ability to adapt to different customers
Team-player mentality
Strong communication skills
Ability to work in a fast moving and dynamic environment
Luxury product knowledge
Fluent in Spanish and English


Gucci is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, disability, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

Job Type

Regular

Start Date

2025-04-21

Schedule

Full time

Organization

Luxury Goods Spain, S.L.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for an AI Engineer to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ

1. Team and Role

If you have experience in developing AI systems, thrive in dynamic startup environments, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to gain full experience within a rapidly growing startup. We are a small, highly committed team with strong connections to other teams, so you'll have the chance to learn and grow quickly. There's a lot to be done! If you're excited about working in an innovative and fast-paced environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is your opportunity! ü§©



2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day as an AI Engineer

As an AI Engineer, you will work hand in hand with one of our Squads to contribute to the key areas of the AI team, primarily:

Development of conversational systems: You will design, implement, and optimize AI products, chatbots, and virtual assistants that enhance the experience of our users.
Integration of third-party AI APIs: You will work with APIs such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini AI, etc., integrating them effectively into our solutions.
Implementation of RAG systems (Retrieval Augmented Generation): You will create systems that combine knowledge bases with generative models for precise and contextualized responses.
Development with specialized libraries: You will use LangChain, LlamaIndex, LangFlow, and our own framework to build robust and scalable AI solutions.
Model evaluation and testing: You will implement evaluation methodologies to continuously measure and improve the performance of our models.
Cost and performance optimization: You will work on continuously improving our AI systems, balancing quality, speed, and operational costs.
Cross-disciplinary collaboration: You will work with product, engineering, and business teams to align AI solutions with strategic objectives.
Applied research: You will stay up-to-date with the latest advances in AI and evaluate new technologies for potential implementation.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

We need someone who...

Has 4 years of experience programming AI solutions in Python, especially in startup or tech company environments.
Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.

It‚Äôs very important that you...

Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.

You‚Äôre perfect for us if you also have experience in...

Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 36.000‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 36.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary.
Up to 15% (6.750‚Ç¨) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid¬†ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1,¬†Cultural Fit:¬†Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2,¬†Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team:¬†Join two members of our Product¬†team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3,¬†Meet the Team:¬†Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check,¬†CEO Chat:¬†Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

  • Has experience with conversational systems and chatbots using large language models (LLMs).
  • Has worked with third-party AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, etc.).
  • Has experience in prompt engineering, dynamic prompt declaration, CoT, and self-evaluation methods.

It‚Äôs very important that you...

  • Are familiar with and have implemented RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
  • Have experience with libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, or LangFlow.
  • Follow best development practices: version control, documentation, unit testing, etc.
  • Are up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in generative AI.

You‚Äôre perfect for us if you also have experience in...

  • Knowledge of Docker, CI/CD, deployment, and DevOps.
  • Knowledge of ML, predictive AI, recommendation systems.
  • Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS Bedrock, Microsoft Azure, or Gemini Vertex.
  • Experience building APIs with frameworks like FastAPI or similar.
  • Experience implementing testing and evaluation methodologies for AI models.


4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 36.000‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

  • Between 36.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary.
  • Up to 15% (6.750‚Ç¨) quarterly bonus based on performance & potential.

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

  • Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
  • Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
  • Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
  • Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
  • Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

  • Organic fruit
  • Free caffeine and theine
5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this May, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

  • Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
  • Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
  • Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
  • Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!


A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: AI Research Scientist
Description:
About Axiomatic_AI:

Axiomatic_AI is dedicated to accelerating R&D by developing the next generation of Automated Interpretable Reasoning, a verifiably truthful AI model built for reasoning in science and engineering, empowering engineers specifically in hardware design and Electronic Design Automation (EDA), with a mission to revolutionize the fields of hardware design and simulation in the photonics and semiconductor industry. We seek highly motivated professionals to help us bring these innovations to life, driving the evolution from development to commercial product.


Position Overview: The AI Research Scientist will work on developing novel AI models for verifiable and interpretable reasoning for science and engineering. You will contribute to the development of novel AI-driven methods for understanding, modeling, and replicating complex behaviors from data. This role will involve a blend of research, experimentation and hands-on implementation and testing, with an emphasis on pushing the boundaries of current AI capabilities.
Key Responsibilities
AI Model Development: Contribute to the development of novel AI reasoning models and architectures, focusing on advanced reasoning techniques and application to scientific fields where rigour and reliability are fundamental
Collaboration: Work closely with a cross-functional team of engineers and scientists, collaborating on solving challenging problems at the intersection of AI, physics, logic, and robotics. Collaborate with universities on developing selected aspects of the product
Documentation and Reporting: Develop detailed technical documentation and present research findings to internal teams and external stakeholders.
Research & Publication: Conduct cutting-edge research and publish results in top AI conferences and journals to contribute to the global AI research community, according to opportunities.
Experience:
Ph.D. in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Physics or related field
Strong background in AI research, with a focus on reasoning, representation learning, reinforcement learning, scientific and engineering applications.
Knowledge of AI algorithm and architectures and familiarity with industry-standard AI tools and libraries
Experience working on projects involving chip design, or more generally scientific applications and optimization
A track record of publications in top-tier AI or machine learning conferences or journals.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python
Understanding of fundamental computer science principles
Proficiency in deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or JAX.
Solid understanding of machine learning principles and architectures
Hands-on experience with large language models, diffusion models, or other state of the art architectures.
Excellent research, analytical and communication skills
What we offer
Competitive Compensation: A mix of salary and stock options for long-term career growth.
Cutting-Edge Tools: Access to state-of-the-art tools and collaborative opportunities with leading experts in artificial intelligence, physics, hardware and electronic design automation.
Work-Life Balance: Flexible work arrangements in one of our offices with potential options for remote work.
Professional Growth: Opportunities to attend industry conferences, present research findings, and engage with the global AI research community.
Company Culture: Join a passionate team focused on solving some of the most challenging problems at the intersection of AI and hardware.
Why Axiomatic_AI? At Axiomatic_AI, you will be working on technology that drives innovation in AI for scientific and engineering applications in line with our 10X30 mission. This is your opportunity to contribute to the development of new AI architectures that can reason coherently and produce interpretable and verifiable solutions. Consequently, see those ideas commercialized into products that will shape the future of hardware and computing, while collaborating with a global team of engineers and AI specialists. We believe in pushing the boundaries of what is possible and continuously seek to redefine the intersection of AI, with focus on formal consistency. If you're ready to take your expertise in artificial intelligence and physics to the next level, we want to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst en Modelos de Riesgo de Cr√©dito (Barcelona o Madrid)
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a m√°s de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posici√≥n privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.




Nuestra raz√≥n de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticip√°ndonos y ocup√°ndonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones econ√≥micas, a trav√©s de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empat√≠a y franqueza.

Y adem√°s, lo hacemos mediante una gesti√≥n responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¬°√önete a nosotros!




¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientaci√≥n a la resoluci√≥n de problemas, con capacidad anal√≠tica y de auto-organizaci√≥n y que sepa trabajar en equipo.




Hablemos del proyecto‚Ä¶




Los modelos de riesgos evolucionan cada d√≠a gracias al aumento en la disponibilidad y capacidad de an√°lisis de datos, permitiendo el desarrollo de nuevas herramientas cuantitativas √∫tiles para la gesti√≥n y toma de decisiones. Esto, junto con las m√∫ltiples exigencias regulatorias sobre el sector bancario, hace que exista una amplia variedad de tareas que requieren un alto grado de implicaci√≥n por su complejidad.




La Direcci√≥n de Modelos de Riesgo tiene como misi√≥n dar soporte a las diversas √°reas encargadas de la modelizaci√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito en Banco Sabadell participando transversalmente de forma activa en los diversos procesos dentro del ciclo de vida de un modelo (an√°lisis de datos, modelizaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, implantaci√≥n y seguimiento), principalmente en la construcci√≥n de las herramientas de calificaci√≥n (rating/scoring) y en la estimaci√≥n de los par√°metros de riesgo (PD, LGD y EAD) para el c√°lculo de capital y provisiones del Grupo Banco Sabadell.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:




Participar√°s en el desarrollo metodol√≥gico de los modelos internos del Grupo Banco Sabadell:




Desarrollo de los modelos de calificaci√≥n crediticia tipo rating/scoring, valorando el potencial riesgo del Banco a trav√©s del an√°lisis de datos y la construcci√≥n de modelos predictivos que permitan explicar el perfil y la capacidad de pago de las empresas y personas f√≠sicas.
Estimaci√≥n y backtest de los modelos internos de PD (Probability of Default), EAD (Exposure At Default), LGD (Loss Given Default) y otros par√°metros para provisiones (IFRS9), para capital regulatorio (IRB) y para planificaci√≥n financiera (Stress Test, ICAAP).
Desarrollo, aplicaci√≥n y seguimiento una vez implementados.
Assessment de compliance con est√°ndares de Banco Sabadell y los requerimientos regulatorios.
Documentaci√≥n modelos y estimaciones para uso en Banco Sabadell.




Dar√°s soporte en auditor√≠as y validaciones tanto internas como externas (supervisor, auditores externos).




Har√°s mantenimiento y desarrollo de las BBDD:




Controles de calidad de datos y conocimiento del proceso.
Planteo de requerimientos a IT y validaci√≥n de la implementaci√≥n de los mismos.




¬øQu√© valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Actuariales, F√≠sica o Ingenier√≠a Superior.




Valoraremos formaci√≥n complementaria (Master o Postgrado) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones como FRM, CQF, Certificaciones en Data Analytics, Modelling, Machine Learning o similar.




Experiencia m√≠nima de 2-3 a√±os en funciones vinculadas a modelos de riesgo de cr√©dito (desarrollo, control, seguimiento, coordinaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, auditor√≠a), en sector Banca.




Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes, con conocimiento del entorno regulatorio y normativa aplicable a riesgo de cr√©dito.




Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS - SQL), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programaci√≥n (Phyton, R) y herramientas de BI (Power BI).




Que aportes un buen nivel de Ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).







Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At TomTom we‚Äôre seeking a Data Scientist to join our Maps Quality and Product Insight team in Madrid. As part of the team, you will help TomTom deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps and locations services for the‚ÄØhundreds of millions of drivers and users of our maps and products around the world and that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

The Maps Quality and Insight team is focused on providing state-of-the-art data & analytics solutions that enable fast and cost-effective data-driven strategic decision making within TomTom and for our customers and partners.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

The impact you'll make


Drive strategic business decisions with insights obtained by manipulating large volumes of data from a variety of different sources:‚ÄØ system logs, satellite imagery, vertical imagery, street level imagery, GPS traces, etc. individually and by fusing several combinations of these sources
Design, develop and maintain data processing pipelines to use these data sources individually or combined and to predict various map features and attributes by applying statistical models/ ML / AI models‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
State the quality level of our maps via statistical experiments that help us understand where we are and why, and deliver effective insights that help drive our map editing strategy‚ÄØ
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model and system performance and data accuracy‚ÄØ
Collaborate with teams from diverse backgrounds (e.g., data scientists, software engineers, product managers, map and GIS experts ‚Ä¶) across the company and with our customers on projects and knowledge sharing‚ÄØ


What you'll need


Minimum 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or Software Engineer (with relevant experience in data analytics projects)
Bachelor‚Äôs/Masters in Computer science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent field‚ÄØ
Good communications skills in English
Strong problem-solving skills
To be team-oriented ‚Äì to be able to communicate with other team members, express doubts, provide and accept constructive feedback
To be passionate about programming and have a solid foundation of software development, and be always eager to learn and improve your skills
Fair statistical knowledge and expertise in designing and testing experiments and drawing conclusions under uncertainty (sampling strategies, robust statistical estimation,...)
Experience in at least one object-oriented language ‚Äì Python is a must, PySpark and Scala is a plus
Experience in various ML / AI techniques and frameworks
Knowledge of SQL and databases
Experience in processing and analysing data to draw insights and produce visualizations (data storitelling)
A passion for learning new technologies and techniques and a curiosity for exploring new possibilities and challenges


What Is Nice To Have


Work experience in Big Data and cloud ecosystems (e.g., Spark, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP‚Ä¶).
Prior experience with working with geospatial and map data and/or with NoSQL databases


What We Offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O‚ÄôReilly and LinkedIn Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work flexibility, where TomTom‚Äôers, in agreement with their manager and team, use both the office and home to focus, collaborate, learn and socialize. It‚Äôs all about getting the best out of both worlds ‚Äì we ask TomTom‚Äôers to come to the office two days a week, and the remaining three are free to be worked in either location.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we‚Äôre mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community ‚Äì we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.

Meet your team

We‚Äôre Maps, a global team within TomTom‚Äôs Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for hundreds of millions of users around the world. Joining our team, you‚Äôll continuously innovate our mapmaking processes, directly contributing to our vision: engineering the world's most trusted and useful map.

At TomTom...

You‚Äôll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we‚Äôll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.

After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you‚Äôll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Nice to meet you!‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre a leader in data and AI. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence ‚Äì and questions into answers.

We‚Äôre also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to IPO-readiness. If you‚Äôre looking for a dynamic, fulfilling internship coupled with flexibility and a world-class employee experience, you‚Äôll find it here.

What You‚Äôll Do

Looking for *that* internship? The game-changing one that‚Äôll help you learn, grow, and chart your path forward? You‚Äôll find it at SAS. Our interns aren‚Äôt coffee runners ‚Äì they do real, meaningful work. Our AP EMEA CareerStart@SAS program is focused on development, culture, and community. We‚Äôll help you grow professionally, find (or further) your passion, and make memorable connections that last beyond the program!

You will join our Pre sales department as Data Science Intern.

A Great Opportunity To Work On The Most Innovative Analytics Solutions And Projects In An International Environment As a Part Of The Pre-Sales Support Team


The best collaborators of the sales people, always ready to discover, study and learn something more and innovative in Solutions, Technical and customer domain.
The presentation‚Äôs gurus; they create pilot and proof of concept to demonstrate how SAS Solution can solve business problems and reach customer needs.


As a Data Scientist Intern, You Will


Support the analytics team in demo and PoCs/PoVs preparations
Working together with analytics team in answering RFI‚Äôs and RFPs
Involvement and Participation in all analytics team meetings


Required Qualifications


Degree Type: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs.
Targeted majors: Business Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering.
You‚Äôre a college student enrolled in an accredited program.
Full proficiency in English and French.
Takes ownership of responsibilities; proven track record of taking initiative and going above and beyond.
Interested in the future of data, AI and technology.
You‚Äôre curious, passionate, authentic, and accountable. These are our‚ÄØvalues ‚ÄØand influence everything we do.
Strong communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal.
You‚Äôre interested in the future of Analytics and embrace technology.nd


Location: Hybrid workplace model, combining office (2-3 days per week) and remote working.

CareerStart Program dates: April/May ‚Äì September/October 2025.

Perks of the job


Work with (and learn from) the best. As a SAS intern, you‚Äôll get face time with our top executives!‚ÄØ
Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage.
Your well-being matters, and that‚Äôs why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you stay healthy and productive.‚ÄØ‚ÄØThis includes an on-site and remote Work/Life Center staffed by master‚Äôs level Social Workers and an Employee Assistance Program.
We work hard, but we like to play hard, too. Enjoy hackathons, social events and other opportunities to connect + engage.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


Diverse and inclusive‚ÄØ

At SAS, it‚Äôs not about fitting into our culture ‚Äì it‚Äôs about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it‚Äôs essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Additional Information

SAS is an equal opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Know Your Rights . Also view the Pay Transparency notice.

Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

SAS only sends emails from verified ‚Äúsas.com‚Äù email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of SAS, please contact Recruitingsupport@sas.com .

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:

Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.




To be successful in the role you must have:

+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills ‚Äì knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more
HTML:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.


Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:

  • Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
  • Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
  • Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
  • Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
  • Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
  • Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
  • Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
  • Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
  • Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.


To be successful in the role you must have:

  • +3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
  • University or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
  • Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
  • Strong Python and PySpark skills ‚Äì knowledge of data management.
  • Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
  • Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
  • Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
  • Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
  • Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
  • Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
  • Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
  • Knowledge of the Agile framework.


What do we offer?

  • Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
  • Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: AI Developer
Description:
Axiomatic_AI's mission:

Axiomatic_AI is launching with the aim to accelerate R&D by "Automated Interpretable Reasoning" (AIR) -- a verifiably truthful AI model built for reasoning in science and engineering. Axiomatic_AI is hiring top talent interested in a future of human reasoning aided by -- not replaced by -- AI, and a future that empowers a new generation of innovators to solve important problems through deep-tech engineering in the semiconductor ecosystem.


Responsibilities:
Take a leading role in designing and implementing advanced reasoning-AI architectures and algorithms, ensuring they are effective and scalable.
Translate project objectives into clear technical software requirements.
Develop cutting-edge AI and machine learning methods for engineering and science.
Work collaboratively with a team of machine learning researchers, deep-tech engineers, and physicists.
Qualifications:


Education: Master's degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or a related field.

Expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing.

Knowledge of AI algorithms and architectures.

Familiarity with industry-standard AI tools and libraries.

Strong research and analytical skills.

Plus: Experience in developing and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems.

Plus: Experience in working with large-scale datasets.


What We Offer:
A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
The opportunity to work on pioneering projects that blend scientific research with practical hardware design.
A culture of learning & innovation ideal for professional development.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We're building a next-generation Analytical Platform for a leading resort and entertainment group in Southeast Asia. The platform will combine large-scale data processing, real-time analytics, and machine learning to power decisions in marketing, customer personalization, operations, and risk management.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, training, and deploying ML models that deliver business value across a wide range of use cases‚Äîsuch as dynamic pricing, customer segmentation, and predictive maintenance.

You'll collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Architects, Business Analysts, and DevOps to bring models from experimentation to production.

Requirements


4+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries/frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, data preprocessing, and evaluation techniques
Experience with ML lifecycle management, including versioning, retraining, and monitoring
Strong knowledge of data wrangling and feature engineering using large datasets
Familiarity with data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Pandas, Dask)
Experience building ML services and APIs for real-time or near real-time applications
Understanding of MLOps concepts and working within CI/CD pipelines for ML



Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to support business cases like personalization, fraud detection, and customer value prediction
Build robust data pipelines for model training and inference using structured and semi-structured data
Perform feature engineering, model optimization, and validation using statistical and ML techniques
Work with Data Engineers to ensure data availability and quality across the ML lifecycle
Use tools for model tracking, versioning, and reproducibility (e.g., MLflow or equivalent)
Package models for deployment and integrate them with APIs, dashboards, or other systems
Monitor and maintain model performance in production and support retraining pipelines
Communicate results clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders



Benefits


35 absence days per year for work-life balance
Udemy courses of your choice
English courses with native-speaker
Regular soft-skills trainings
Excellence –°enters meetups
Online/offline team-buildings
Business trips

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View‚Ñ¢ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

Mission


Develop Marketing Science solutions in the area of media analytics
Support the product development during concept testing phases, scaling and production
Transform proofs-of-concept into scalable, production-ready code


Responsibilities


Develop, implement and standardize marketing science solutions in proofs-of-concept and prototypes
Continuously improve the efficiency of the marketing science products (e.g. ensure quality by adherence to coding guidelines, documentation and reproducibility)
Optimize marketing science models using code optimization, high-performance computing and real-time techniques
Build analytical pipelines at scale using cloud services, containerized applications and distributed systems
Identify best practices and create continuous improvement of tools and methods
Closely collaborate with Product Owners, Modellers, Marketing Scientists and Front End Software Engineers


Qualifications


Bachelor or Master degree that reflects strong statistical/mathematical/computer science skills
Strong expertize in Python usage - at least 3 years of development
Understanding of R
Experienced in statistical modelling on top of predictive modeling
Able to manage code deployments (experience with GIT)
Basic understanding of Dockerization ‚Äì building and managing docker images
Experienced with creating, managing and/or maintaining code documentation
Solid skills concerning performance optimization and scalability (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, functions as a service)
Ability to present and explain complex concepts to less experienced colleagues


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work independently
Good attention to detail ‚Äì ensure all outputs are delivered professionally and accurate
Good interpersonal skills ‚Äì treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit
Well-organised and flexible, and demonstrate self-confidence, decisiveness and commitment able to work alone without constant support, and well organized
Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment


Additional Information

Hybrid : 1 a week at Madrid office - Flex working mode

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist (Full Remote within Spain)
Description:
About Us

At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, our Business Intelligence team is excited to welcome a motivated Data Scientist to help us align our work with business goals to drive organizational success.

As a Data Scientist, you'll play a vital role in big data analysis and be responsible for maintaining and enhance data quality. Working closely with key stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on both our products and processes.

If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating across departments, and driving results, this role is perfect for you!

YOUR MISSION

As a Data Scinetist at Leadtech, you will:


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities within datasets
Create effective reports and visualizations to communicate key findings to the company's teams and support data-informed decision-making
Calculate and apply algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Collaborate closely with business intelligence specialists, data scientists and other team members to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions
Perform ad-hoc research to address specific business-related questions
Continually maintain and enhance data quality, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
Participate in the identification and collection of new data relevant to business objectives
Contribute to the evaluation of new tools and technologies for data management and analysis
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills



Requirements

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD

We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering (Industrial Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering), or a similar discipline
Demonstrated experience in Data Science environment
Solid knowledge of data science/analysis tools, such as KNIME, SPSS, or similar tools
Ability to develop, train, and optimize machine learning models
Experience in predictive modeling, time series analysis, or cluster analysis
Experience in calculating and applying algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Ability to tackle complex problems, identify patterns, and design creative data-driven solutions
Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends in technology and data science
Experience with databases and query languages, such as SQL
Ability to create effective visualizations using tools like Qlik Sense, QlikView or similar
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities



Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!



Comprehensive Benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!



Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

  • If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
  • Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary

Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Scientist - Data Science (Openbank)
Description:
Country: Spain

Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:


Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.


To be successful in the role you must have:


+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills ‚Äì knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

Title: Product Manager, AI
Description:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from tiny startups who get up and running quickly, to major corporations with tens of thousands of users. That's why people love us.

We make a product that is actually pleasurable to use, in a very technical space, serving a range of user personas across our two main lines of business: internal BI and embedded analytics.

Our business is thriving and expanding our product in both depth and breadth. Specifically, we‚Äôre growing our AI-backed products and looking for a Product Manager to join our highly technical, UX-appreciative and craftsmanship-aligned team.

PMing at Metabase is a bit different than elsewhere, in how much we emphasize deep understanding of problems, of the technical realities of the product and the importance of delivering reliably simple and user-aligned software. It rewards intellectual curiosity, customer empathy and systematic thinking and doesn‚Äôt focus on strict metric optimization or a ship-ship-ship attitude. We ship, but we do it well.

Responsibilities

Like other PMs on the team, this role will need you to:


Develop deep knowledge and empathy for users needs in the areas they tackle. This involves reviewing existing issues, tickets, docs, engaging in lots of interviews and evaluating quantitative data
Understand the underlying mechanics of the product at a technical level. They don‚Äôt need to read/write code, but need to have the curiosity and ability to over time understand how things work and develop instincts for what‚Äôs easy/hard
Develop strategies for solving clusters of users needs in thoughtful ways, ultimately delivering product docs which frame needs in actionable ways for designers and engineers
Steward projects forward, helping keep focus, momentum, and continuously re-evaluating scope, with flexibility and appreciation for technical constraints and UX considerations
Follow-up on the outcomes of projects they ship, quantitatively and qualitatively
Collaborate with the rest of the team, consistently seeking and providing feedback, as well as pitching ideas for how to advance the product



And specifically to:


Identify opportunities for leveraging ML/LLMs in the product through a mix of strong intuition for use case/solution matches and focused, benchmark-centric experimentation
Nurture the development of AI projects with particularly strong quantified success criteria, like defining benchmark expectations, sourcing benchmark sample data, gauging likely plateaus for improvement, etc
Elevate the broader PM team‚Äôs knowledge of how to ship and iterate upon LLM features



Responsibilities don‚Äôt include:


Managing people, herding cats, writing code, making mocks, using JIRA



About You


Excited to belly flop into the non-deterministic and reliably unpredictable world of LLM-backed projects
Able and interested in staying up-to-date with developments in the world of LLMs and adjacent technologies, with a bias towards tinkering on your own
A thorough thinker, able to be both diligent with details but systematic to see the big picture
Appreciative of clean but powerful user experiences (and the hard work their require)
Able to keep a vision in mind, but break the path to it into small, doable, valuable steps
Motivated to work asynchronously in a global team, and with the written communication chops to do it effectively
More interested in the Product than the Management part of Product Management



Skills And Experience


3+ years shipping ML products as part of a Product+Eng team, with good understanding of the underlying mechanisms (you can‚Äôt just lob requirements over the fence and hope for good things, you need to understand the details)
5+ years as a PM in a technical environment (this is not a role for junior PMs), shipping user-facing software (not just infra). Preference for the analytics/databases/developer tools space, but you can have built any sort of product as long as it had some real technical complexity
Demonstrable experience leveraging LLMs as building blocks in complex workflows (either professionally or in personal projects), with strong understanding of underlying mechanics (aka no simple prompt wrappers)
Driven and experienced in helping others continuously deliver work through influence, not authority
Skills you don't need: up-to-date coding skills, customer management, cloud infra knowledge, horse whispering



When applying, make sure your cover letter and or resume clearly spell out your ML/LLM experience.

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want), autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development. We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the next level for years to come.

For U.S. applicants: Metabase participates in the federal E-Verify program, which confirms employment authorization of newly hired U.S. based employees. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates and is only initiated upon hire.

Right to Work Notice (English/Spanish)

HTML:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from tiny startups who get up and running quickly, to major corporations with tens of thousands of users. That's why people love us.

We make a product that is actually pleasurable to use, in a very technical space, serving a range of user personas across our two main lines of business: internal BI and embedded analytics.

Our business is thriving and expanding our product in both depth and breadth. Specifically, we‚Äôre growing our AI-backed products and looking for a Product Manager to join our highly technical, UX-appreciative and craftsmanship-aligned team.

PMing at Metabase is a bit different than elsewhere, in how much we emphasize deep understanding of problems, of the technical realities of the product and the importance of delivering reliably simple and user-aligned software. It rewards intellectual curiosity, customer empathy and systematic thinking and doesn‚Äôt focus on strict metric optimization or a ship-ship-ship attitude. We ship, but we do it well.

  • Demonstrable experience leveraging LLMs as building blocks in complex workflows (either professionally or in personal projects), with strong understanding of underlying mechanics (aka no simple prompt wrappers)
