Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hello! We are Volotea, the airline of small and mid-sized cities in Europe.

As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in driving business optimization across various departments. You‚Äôll build and maintain algorithms, machine learning models, forecasting tools, and data-driven experiments that directly enhance operations, strategy, and more.

This is an incredible opportunity to combine your analytical skills with creativity to solve complex problems, collaborate with diverse teams, and make a real impact on our growth.



How will you contribute to our success?

üîπ¬†Problem-solving and team integration ‚Äì Combine independent problem-solving tasks with proactive integration in a highly dynamic team.

üîπ Develop optimization solutions ‚Äì Build algorithms, models, and forecasting tools to enhance various departments.


üîπ Enhance data-driven processes ‚Äì Use different data sources to identify, define and develop new process optimization strategies.

üîπ Continuous improvement ‚Äì Maintain and update existing models and algorithms for ongoing efficiency.

üîπ Stay ahead of trends ‚Äì Apply industry trends and recent academic research to improve workflows and processes.


Why join us?

‚úàÔ∏è Travel the world for less

Enjoy exclusive deals with 180+ airlines‚Äîfly with your family for up to 4-5 times less than standard fares, just covering airport taxes. Weekend getaways or global adventures? You decide!

üèô A prime location in Barcelona ‚Äì And no, we‚Äôre not located at the airport!

You may not have seen us at Barcelona Airport, but there‚Äôs a reason for that‚Äîyou‚Äôll understand when you get to know us! üòâ Our HQ is in a top area, surrounded by great restaurants, shops, and services.

ü§ù We work hard, but we have fun too!

We love bringing people together with events like:üé≠ Carnival parties üé¢ Trips to Port Aventura üéø Ski getaways üèÉ Running clubs üèì Paddle & ping-pong tournaments

We‚Äôre an active, social team‚Äîthere‚Äôs always something happening!

‚ö° Make an impact ‚Äì Bring your ideas to life! üöÄ

At Volotea, your ideas matter. We give you the space and support to create, innovate, and shape the company‚Äôs future.

üìù A benefits plan that works for you

Customize your benefits! Allocate part of your salary to dining, transport, or health insurance, tax-free‚Äîmeaning more savings for the things you love!

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Your well-being comes first

Enjoy discounted gym memberships, free fresh fruit, and coffee to keep you energized.

üåç A global teamwork

In a diverse, multicultural environment where teamwork and innovation drive success.

üìà Grow your career with us

Access training in soft skills, office tools, and languages to boost your career.

‚öñ Work-Life balance ‚Äì Flexibility to thrive

With flexible schedules, hybrid work, flexible vacations, and your birthday off, you can grow professionally without compromising your well-being.



What will make you succeed in this position:
Degree in an analytical field ‚Äì e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar fields.
1+ year of experience ‚Äì in data mining, software development, statistics, or machine learning.
Strong Python programming skills¬†
SQL knowledge for managing and querying data efficiently.¬†Experience with SQL DB Systems¬† (Postgres, MySQL, or SQL Server) is considered a plus.
Software design & testing previous experience
Creative & analytical Thinking ‚Äì needed to approach problems in innovative ways and deliver solutions.
Clear communication skills ‚Äì¬† for collaborating with teams and explaining complex data insights.
Fluent in Spanish & English


Will be highly valued:

Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science, AI, Machine Learning, or similar fields.
Mathematical optimization experience ‚Äì knowledge of metaheuristics, linear/integer programming, etc.
Cloud platform knowledge ‚Äì Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
Big data ‚Äì Familiarity with technologies like Spark, Hadoop, Hive, or Impala.

Title: MACHINE LEARNING
Description:
En Mango vestimos de pasi√≥n todo lo que hacemos. Con origen en Barcelona y presencia en m√°s de 120 pa√≠ses, inspiramos al mundo con creatividad, innovaci√≥n y autenticidad.

Nuestro equipo multicultural es el motor de nuestro √©xito. nos enorgullece llevar la moda m√°s all√°, conectando nuestro estilo √∫nico con personas de todo el mundo.

Estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist especializado en Natural Language Processing y Large Language Models para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Sobre Mango

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy din√°mico, motivado por las nuevas tecnolog√≠as, con pasi√≥n por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a trav√©s de los datos.

Formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones m√°s desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango est√° formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers e Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la √∫ltima tecnolog√≠a en plataformas de Big Data y computaci√≥n distribuida.

Cada Una De Los Squads De An√°lisis Avanzado Tiene Como Objetivo Desarrollar y Evolucionar Algoritmos De Aprendizaje Autom√°tico Para Hacer Frente a Algunos De Los Principales Retos T√©cnicos y Empresariales De Mango


Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Equipo transversal responsable de impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc) en el cual se incorporar√° la persona seleccionada. Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Adem√°s, es responsable de impulsar la transformaci√≥n que se est√° llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generaci√≥n de im√°genes. Este equipo realizar√° investigaci√≥n de los diferentes algoritmos disponibles para evaluar su madurez y utilidad dentro de Mango para llevar a cabo pruebas de concepto y su posterior puesta en producci√≥n.
Personalization Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes del sitio web y de la App de Mango, incluyendo recomendaciones de producto, ajuste y tama√±o, aprovechando las capacidades de despliegue en tiempo real y el flujo de clics en tiempo real.
Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico que determinen las promociones y descuentos √≥ptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.
Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detecci√≥n temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cu√°ntas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificaci√≥n de la temporada.


Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

Tu Nuevo Puesto

Como Data Scientist especializado en NLP y LLM formar√°s parte del equipo que trabaja en la investigaci√≥n definici√≥n, experimentaci√≥n, prototipado y puesta en producci√≥n de soluciones innovadoras basadas en algoritmos generativos de √∫ltima generaci√≥n.

En tu d√≠a a d√≠a‚Ä¶


Trabajar√°s con modelos de Deep Learning complejos como los Large Language Models (LLM) para abordar m√∫ltiples casos de uso. Definir√°s y llevar√°s a cabo experimentos para realizar el entrenamiento o fine tuning de estos modelos de acuerdo con las necesidades de cada caso de uso.
Trabajar√°s con una gran variedad de datos (estructurados y no estructurados), definiendo las fuentes de datos relevantes y preparando el set de datos necesario para entrenar los modelos de Deep Learning.
Implementar√°s el prototipo de soluciones con algoritmos de Deep Learning para validar la viabilidad t√©cnica y la calidad de los resultados con los equipos de negocio.
Estar√°s conectado a los √∫ltimos desarrollos en Deep Learning e invertir√°s tiempo en traer nuevos algoritmos a Mango. Evaluaras modelos de diferentes tipos para evaluar la calidad de las soluciones y su posible utilidad.


Sobre Ti


Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de data scientist con corpus de textos empleando t√©cnicas cl√°sicas de NLP y modelos de Deep learning como LSTM o BERT. Se valorar√° la experiencia entrenando o haciendo fine tuning de LLM en casos reales.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones software basadas en Machine Learning y capacidad para definir la experimentaci√≥n necesaria en este tipo de proyectos. Se valora positivamente haber liderado el desarrollo end-2-end de un proyecto desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producci√≥n y mantenimiento.
Experiencia en el uso de librer√≠as enfocadas a Deep Learning como Tensorflow o PyTorch.
Al menos 4 a√±os de experiencia desarrollando en Python, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Se valora positivamente el conocimiento de la teor√≠a en la que se basan los modelos de Deep Learning, as√≠ como de las mejores pr√°cticas en su entrenamiento y puesta en producci√≥n.
Se valora positivamente las publicaciones en revistas cient√≠ficas y congresos sobre Machine Learning.
Se valora muy positivamente el inter√©s en buenas pr√°cticas de programaci√≥n y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.
Se valora haber trabajado con servicios cloud (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar, y una mentalidad hands-on.


Tus Beneficios


Incorporaci√≥n inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayor√≠a de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.

35% de descuento en todas nuestras l√≠neas
Te podr√°s formar a nivel t√©cnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, as√≠ como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompa√±amos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Pol√≠tica de referrals, podr√°s participar en la incorporaci√≥n de talento a nuestros equipos, ¬°y te recompensaremos por ello!
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vall√®s para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, as√≠ como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de pr√°cticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribuci√≥n flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro m√©dico, formaci√≥n, descuento comedor, guarder√≠as etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del men√∫ diario, as√≠ como los art√≠culos de cafeter√≠a.
Servicio m√©dico propio en las instalaciones de la central.

Title: Data Science (Shock, Organic Dysfunction and Resuscitation Research Group (SODIR))
Company: Vall d‚ÄôHebron Institute of Research (VHIR) - Vall d'Hebron Institut de Recerca
Description:
The Shock, organ dysfunction and resuscitation group is a multidisciplinary research team with different lines of research about the critically ill patient. VHIR offers vacancy/vacant position for an administrative within the Intensive Care Unit. More information about our group can be found here https://vhir.vallhebron.com/en/research/shock-organ-dysfunction-and-resuscitation

Education and qualifications:

Required:


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in informatics, Data Science or Mathematics or Engineering
Fluency in Catalan, Spanish, English (business level)


Experience and knowledge:

Required:


At least 1 year of experience working in health research data science and clinical data.
Experienced with SAP or management program.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.


Main responsibilities and duties:


Designing statistical analysis plans and data quality plans.
When requiring collaborating with other members of the team to determine study designs.
Reviewing and providing input for scientific tasks.


Labour conditions:


Full-time position: 40h/week.
Starting date: May
Gross annual salary: Remuneration will depend on experience and skills (Salary ranges are consistent with our Collective Agreement pay scale).
Contract: Technical and scientific activities contract linked to the project activities.


What can we offer?


Incorporation to Vall d‚ÄôHebron Research Institute (VHIR), a public sector institution that promotes and develops the biomedical research, innovation and teaching at Vall d'Hebron University Hospital (HUVH), the biggest hospital of Barcelona and the largest of Catalan Institute of Health (ICS).
A scientific environment of excellence, highly dynamic, where high-end biomedical projects are continuously developed.
Continuous learning and a wide range of responsibilities within a stimulating work environment.
Individual training opportunities.
Flexible working hours.
23 days of holidays + 9 personal days.
Flexible Remuneration Program (including dining checks, health insurance, transportation and more)
Corporate Benefits: platform through which you can obtain significant discounts on travel, culture, technology, gastronomy, sports... among many others.
Healthy Offering: choose from a variety of wellbeing focused activities to be the healthiest you.

As reflected in our values we work toward ensuring inclusion and equal opportunity in recruitment, hiring, training, and management for all staff within the organization, regardless of gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, religion, age, functional diversity or ethnicity.

Title: Un/a T√®cnic/a de comunicaci√≥ cient√≠fica-√Ärea de Participaci√≥ del Pacient en Recerca
Company: Fundaci√≥ de Recerca Sant Joan de D√©u
Description:
The Patient Engagement in Research Area at the Sant Joan de D√©u Foundation is looking for a professional to manage the communication tasks of the Share4Rare platform (www.share4rare.org) as well as other projects related to science communication.

Share4Rare is an online platform that brings together a patient community and various research projects focused on rare diseases. These projects are based on the donation of medical and quality-of-life information by adult patients and caregivers of children living with a rare disease. Share4Rare offers services to researchers interested in conducting collaborative research initiatives with patients and families at both national and international levels, enabling research into a group of diseases characterized by low prevalence.

The communication activities of the Area include: management of social media, creation of blog posts and news content, design of outreach materials, reporting on research project results, and the scientific management and editing of the podcast "La Ciencia de lo Singular‚Äù, among other actions.

We are looking for a dynamic individual to join an interdisciplinary team involved in numerous internal, national, and international projects. We offer ongoing training opportunities.

Main Responsabilities


Creation of content for different types of outreach materials and in various formats: blog articles, video and podcast scripts, brochures, posters, newsletters, presentations, social media, etc.
Creation, review, and editing of educational content related to the institution‚Äôs research.
Management and updating of the website, social media, and other platforms with relevant content.
Independent visual layout design for generating presentations, graphics for social media, and other visual materials.
Analysis of website and social media metrics.
Coordination of the department‚Äôs communication and facilitation of interaction and information flow with the communication teams of IRSJD and HSJD.
Support in organizing events, talks, and conferences.
Preparation, planning, and conducting of interviews.



Requirements:

Requeriments


Academic background in communication and/or scientific fields.
Excellent writing skills and ability to create engaging, accurate, and relevant content.
Ability to adapt tone and style according to the target audience and communication channels.
Strong analytical and synthesis skills.
Initiative, autonomy, and proactivity.
Creativity and innovation in developing new formats.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Teamwork skills and ability to collaborate with different departments within the institution.
Basic knowledge of SEO and email marketing campaigns; experience with Mailchimp.
Experience using Canva for design tasks.
Proficiency in social media management platforms such as Notion and Metricool.
Experience with content management systems (CMS): Drupal.
High level of English proficiency.



What we offer


Full-time position within a young, dynamic team in a high-level scientific environment (37,5 H/week)
Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work
Flexible compensation program (including meal vouchers, health insurance, transport, and more)
Corporate benefits platform offering significant discounts on travel, culture, technology, gastronomy, sports, and many other areas
Individual development plans with access to specific training opportunities to support professional career growth

Title: ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About the Job


We‚Äôre hiring ML Engineer to join our awesome and growing team. In this role, you will have the privilege of working on innovative projects in machine learning, utilising your expertise to develop impactful solutions. From conceptualisation to execution, you will play a pivotal role in leading and contributing to comprehensive projects.





Collect raw data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and data streams, ensuring accuracy and consistency through thorough cleaning.


Design/Develop/Integrate practical machine learning (ML) solutions across different industries and use cases to create robust ML systems.


Conduct machine learning tests and experiments.


Work closely with cross-functional teams (engineers, managers) to understand business requirements and develop data-driven solutions.


Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and machine learning.


Participate in agile SCRUM teams for tool and prototype development.





About the job:





A degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field is required. A master‚Äôs degree in data science is a plus.


Professional working experience in the field.


Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.


Working experience with LLMs and related techniques.


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Excellent communication in English and interpersonal skills.


Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.


Software skills are highly desirable.





Benefits:





Competitive salary


Flexible work schedule and remote work options


+2 days extra off (Christmas and NYE)


Travel budget to explore Munich and/or Barcelona


Company-sponsored social events, (e.g., team-retreats in Mallorca, Italy) and team-building activities (e.g., yearly Christmas hackathon)


Opportunities for growth and advancement within MVST (e.g., ‚Ç¨1.500 on top, sponsored Udemy courses)


Free language courses


Home office budget


Sponsored gym membership


Digital vouchers for meals and (public) transport tickets


Monthly company breakfast and lunch


Free coffee, water, fresh fruits and snacks, granola bar for breakfasts

Title: Research Engineer ‚Äì Machine Learning (Re1)
Description:
Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer ‚Äì Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center ‚Äì Centro Nacional de Supercomputaci√≥n (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain.

It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe.

The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress.

BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research.

In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO.

It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists.

The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data.

The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.Requirements Education: Bachelor or Master's in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.

Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience: Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience: Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/or distributed training using Dask.Understanding of climate and weather models.Competences: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.Proficiency in written and spoken English.Conditions The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department.

We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures.

Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration.

Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement.

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona.

Starting date: 01/03/2025.

Applications procedure and process All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

A full CV in English including contact details.A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered.

Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included.

Applications without this document will not be considered.Development of the recruitment process The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposici√≥n").

The Recruitment Process Consists Of Two Phases

Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position.

‚Äì 40 points.Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources.

In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated.

‚Äì 60 points.

A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process.

After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview.

At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes.

For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact ******.

Deadline The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired.

Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R).

This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.

We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

Title: R&D Scientist
Description:
What is XFuel anyway? üöÄüå≥‚õΩ

Our mission is to decarbonise the transportation industry, and we devote our technology, time and talent to the planet, advancing the transition to sustainable low-carbon fuels. We are committed to leveraging our expertise to accelerate the transition away from fossil fuels, reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions while maintaining fuel affordability and reliability.

To achieve global net-zero goals, the world urgently needs affordable, scalable, sustainable liquid fuel solutions. Unlike alternative fuel technologies that require costly infrastructure changes, over the last 10 years, XFuel has developed and patented technologies to produce sustainable drop-in fuels that integrate seamlessly into existing transportation systems, including marine, road, and aviation sectors.

XFuel is backed by world-class VCs and ideally positioned to scale as a leading sustainable fuel company. Our drop-in fuels seamlessly replace fossil fuels without requiring blending, engine modifications, or additional infrastructure investment for distribution or storage. With project capital requirements significantly lower than traditional alternatives and production costs comparable to or below fossil fuel market prices, our approach is both cost-effective and scalable.

We have successfully demonstrated our technology through operational pilot plants and a low-risk, modular scale-up strategy that enables efficient commercial deployment. Our focus is on building, owning, and operating plants globally, producing sustainable fuels with significant GHG savings and providing a viable solution for the decarbonization of transportation. As we continue to grow, we are looking for passionate individuals who share our mission, values, and drive to accelerate the transition to cleaner fuels.

What is my mission? ‚Äç‚Äçüë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª

Your mission will be to support XFuel's science team in advancing our next-generation fuel technologies. You'll play a hands-on role in analysing fuel samples, assisting in sample collection, and helping to prepare and run trials in our pilot plant. Working closely with the science team, you'll gain exposure to real-world R&D while contributing to high-impact experiments and data analysis. This is a fast-paced and collaborative environment where your responsibilities will grow with your skills and initiative. From day one, you'll be trusted with meaningful work that supports XFuel's mission to reshape the future of sustainable fuels.

Requirements

Specific responsibilities will include:


Sampling & Analysis: Assist with collecting, packaging, labelling, sending, and analysing samples from our pilot plant and R&D trials
Trial Support: Help prepare and run small- and medium-scale tests alongside the science team, ensuring accurate documentation and data tracking
Properly handle, label, and dispose of chemical waste and reagents in accordance with environmental guidelines
Lab Operations: Support the day-to-day functioning of the lab, including materials prep, equipment checks, and safe handling/ storage of samples and chemicals following lab GMPs
Data & Reporting: Work with scientists to input, clean, and interpret experimental data, contributing to reports and presentations
Process Improvement: Observe and review lab and trial processes to suggest and implement small optimisations
Cross-functional Projects: Support ad-hoc scientific and operational tasks, depending on project needs ‚Äî this may include logistics coordination or working with suppliers on sample shipments
Support lab and analytical equipment maintenance, writing SOPs and ensuring the reagent stockage for work maintenance and work
Participate in safety audits and risk assessments to maintain a compliant laboratory environment



We're looking for someone who: üß†üíöü•á


Holds a bachelor's degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, environmental science, or a related field
Ideally has 1-2 years of lab, R&D, or pilot plant experience (internships or university labs are great too)
Is hands-on, detail-oriented, and confident working with lab equipment, samples, and technical processes
Moderate experience in TAN/TBN, viscosity and density measurements, GC-MS, FTIR, and elemental analysis of fuel samples, as well as data analysis from these instruments, will be a plus
Has basic proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, or basic lab software)
Communicates clearly and works well in a collaborative, interdisciplinary team
Is curious, proactive, and excited about solving real-world climate and energy challenges
Is eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced, startup environment where no two days are the same
Is eligible to live and work in the EU



It would be beneficial to have familiarity with: üß†ü•à


Bilingual (English & Spanish) with clear and confident communication



Benefits

Benefits üí∞


High-impact mission and purpose-driven team / culture
Competitive salary
Temporary housing assistance while you search for a place of your own
Startup equity + incentives
Enhanced parental leave
Monthly Team lunches and socials
Working from one of the most incredible places to live!



Location üåç

Mallorca, Spain (GMT +1) - It doesn't get any better!

Our Values üôå

We focus on impact - we work on problems that have the biggest impact.

We innovate to better serve our planet - we believe innovation is crucial in tackling climate change.

We act with integrity - do what's right, even when it's hard.

We are passionate and win together - we know that success is a result of great teams, positive energy and collaboration

What if you're a partial fit? üå±

We prioritise grit, positivity, and the willingness to get stuck in, and encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't exactly match this job description.

Equal employment opportunity üåà

XFuel is an equal opportunity employer: we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View‚Ñ¢ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

Mission


Develop Marketing Science solutions in the area of media analytics
Support the product development during concept testing phases, scaling and production
Transform proofs-of-concept into scalable, production-ready code


Responsibilities


Develop, implement and standardize marketing science solutions in proofs-of-concept and prototypes
Continuously improve the efficiency of the marketing science products (e.g. ensure quality by adherence to coding guidelines, documentation and reproducibility)
Optimize marketing science models using code optimization, high-performance computing and real-time techniques
Build analytical pipelines at scale using cloud services, containerized applications and distributed systems
Identify best practices and create continuous improvement of tools and methods
Closely collaborate with Product Owners, Modellers, Marketing Scientists and Front End Software Engineers


Qualifications


Bachelor or Master degree that reflects strong statistical/mathematical/computer science skills
Strong expertize in Python usage - at least 3 years of development
Understanding of R
Experienced in statistical modelling on top of predictive modeling
Able to manage code deployments (experience with GIT)
Basic understanding of Dockerization ‚Äì building and managing docker images
Experienced with creating, managing and/or maintaining code documentation
Solid skills concerning performance optimization and scalability (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, functions as a service)
Ability to present and explain complex concepts to less experienced colleagues


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work independently
Good attention to detail ‚Äì ensure all outputs are delivered professionally and accurate
Good interpersonal skills ‚Äì treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit
Well-organised and flexible, and demonstrate self-confidence, decisiveness and commitment able to work alone without constant support, and well organized
Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment


Additional Information

Hybrid : 1 a week at Madrid office - Flex working mode

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location: Barcelona ‚Äì Sanofi Business Services

Flexible working: 60% home office / week

Job type: Permanent, Full time

About The Digital GBUs

We are an innovative global healthcare company, driven by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. Our team, across some 100 countries, is dedicated to transforming the practice of medicine by working to turn the impossible into the possible. We provide potentially life-changing treatment options and life-saving vaccine protection to millions of people globally, while putting sustainability and social responsibility at the centre of our ambitions.

Sanofi‚Äôs Digital organization‚Äôs mission is to transform Sanofi into a data-first and AI first organization by empowering everyone with good data. Through custom developed AI products built on world class data foundations and platforms, the team builds value and a unique competitive advantage that scales across our markets, R&D and manufacturing sites. The team is located in major hubs in Paris, Lyon, Barcelona, Cambridge, Bridgewater, Toronto and most recently Budapest and Hyderabad. Join a dynamic, fast paced and talented Barcelona team, with world class mentorship, using AI to chase the miracle of science.

About Growing With Us

In this role you will develop globally scalable AI solutions (conventional AI & Generative AI) that are strategically prioritized by the Sanofi commercial area across Global Business Units (Pharma & Vaccines) for the betterment of our global patients and customers. Examples of AI projects include, but are not limited to, Next Best action driven Omnichannel Engagement, Leverage data & AI to identify Patient, enhanced & personalized Patient experience, Marketing Mix Model, AI Alerts to proactively identify the growth opportunities and Market dynamics product lines. You will specifically,


Apply data science expertise in machine learning, LLM, deep learning, statistics, text-mining/NLP, forecasting and optimization to multiple analytics projects
Build models, algorithms, simulations, and experiments by writing highly optimized code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologies
Work on full-spectrum of activities, from conducting ML experiments to delivering production-ready models
Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver AI-based data products
Work closely with product owners, developers, engineers, and MLOps to deliver AI/ML solutions
Adhere to and promote to best practices and standards for data science process (including documentation) and code developments
Remains up to date with industry practices and emerging technologies such as generative AI and test creative ways of offering AI solutions to enhance existing solutions
undefined


About You

Key Functional Requirements and qualifications


Hands-on AI/ML modeling experience of complex datasets combined with strong understanding of theoretical foundations of AI/ML
Expertise within most of the following areas: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, LLM, reinforcement learning, federated learning, time series forecasting, Bayesian statistics, optimization
Experience creating and deploying code libraries using functions, classes in Python in AI product-focused development under an agile environment
Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computing environments (e.g. AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark)
Experience in production-ready software development
Experience in communicating with business, expressing important DS concepts in a non-technical way, interpreting feedback from business
Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, data visualization and data storytelling skills
Nice to have experience in life sciences and healthcare and experience in a complex global organization
A demonstrated ability to work and collaborate in a team environment
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment and to manage multiple priorities
Fluent in English (Other languages a plus)


Key Technical Requirements And Qualifications


PhD in computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics or a related quantitative discipline with strong coding skills with 2+ years of analytical experience, OR Master‚Äôs Degree in relevant domain with 3+ years of analytical experience
Expertise with core data science languages (predominantly with Python, and nice to have R & Scala), experience working with Snowflake and other different database systems (such as SQL, NoSQL)
Should have experience of AI/ML development (CI/CD, Orchestration)
Experience working in cloud-based environment such as AWS or GCP or Azure and using cloud-technologies for building AI-solutions
Experience of playing with LLMs
Knowledge of Tableau, Power BI, Plotly, git/version control systems or similar
Experience with various enterprise-level Application Programming Interfaces (APIs)
Nice to have experience in using some data science tools such as datarobot, dataiku, Alteryx


When Joining Our Team, You Will Experience


An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
An attractive, market-oriented salary and cafeteria benefits
Flexible home office policy, with a possibility to work up to 60% of time from home / where you can easily schedule your office days
Work from an "Office of the Year 2020" finalist office
Collective life and accident insurance
Yearly medical check-up
Exposure to training and certification pathways for technical and functional skills from AWS, SnowFlake, Informatica and others
An individual and well-structured introduction and training of new employees and we will dedicate a Buddy for you to better navigate in your first weeks
Your own career path within Sanofi. Your professional and personal development will be supported purposefully


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Title: Data Scientist (Full Remote within Spain)
Description:
About Us

At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, our Business Intelligence team is excited to welcome a motivated Data Scientist to help us align our work with business goals to drive organizational success.

As a Data Scientist, you'll play a vital role in big data analysis and be responsible for maintaining and enhance data quality. Working closely with key stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on both our products and processes.

If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating across departments, and driving results, this role is perfect for you!

YOUR MISSION

As a Data Scinetist at Leadtech, you will:


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities within datasets
Create effective reports and visualizations to communicate key findings to the company's teams and support data-informed decision-making
Calculate and apply algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Collaborate closely with business intelligence specialists, data scientists and other team members to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions
Perform ad-hoc research to address specific business-related questions
Continually maintain and enhance data quality, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
Participate in the identification and collection of new data relevant to business objectives
Contribute to the evaluation of new tools and technologies for data management and analysis
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills



Requirements

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD

We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering (Industrial Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering), or a similar discipline
Demonstrated experience in Data Science environment
Solid knowledge of data science/analysis tools, such as KNIME, SPSS, or similar tools
Ability to develop, train, and optimize machine learning models
Experience in predictive modeling, time series analysis, or cluster analysis
Experience in calculating and applying algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Ability to tackle complex problems, identify patterns, and design creative data-driven solutions
Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends in technology and data science
Experience with databases and query languages, such as SQL
Ability to create effective visualizations using tools like Qlik Sense, QlikView or similar
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities



Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!



Comprehensive Benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!



Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We're building a next-generation Analytical Platform for a leading resort and entertainment group in Southeast Asia. The platform will combine large-scale data processing, real-time analytics, and machine learning to power decisions in marketing, customer personalization, operations, and risk management.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, training, and deploying ML models that deliver business value across a wide range of use cases‚Äîsuch as dynamic pricing, customer segmentation, and predictive maintenance.

You'll collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Architects, Business Analysts, and DevOps to bring models from experimentation to production.

Requirements


4+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries/frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, data preprocessing, and evaluation techniques
Experience with ML lifecycle management, including versioning, retraining, and monitoring
Strong knowledge of data wrangling and feature engineering using large datasets
Familiarity with data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Pandas, Dask)
Experience building ML services and APIs for real-time or near real-time applications
Understanding of MLOps concepts and working within CI/CD pipelines for ML



Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to support business cases like personalization, fraud detection, and customer value prediction
Build robust data pipelines for model training and inference using structured and semi-structured data
Perform feature engineering, model optimization, and validation using statistical and ML techniques
Work with Data Engineers to ensure data availability and quality across the ML lifecycle
Use tools for model tracking, versioning, and reproducibility (e.g., MLflow or equivalent)
Package models for deployment and integrate them with APIs, dashboards, or other systems
Monitor and maintain model performance in production and support retraining pipelines
Communicate results clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders



Benefits


35 absence days per year for work-life balance
Udemy courses of your choice
English courses with native-speaker
Regular soft-skills trainings
Excellence –°enters meetups
Online/offline team-buildings
Business trips
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Xebia

With over 20 years of experience, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftsmen deliver cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of transformation. Since 2001, we have grown from a Java company into a full-service digital consulting company with 5,500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition.

We are organized in complementary service lines ‚Äì teams with a tremendous amount of knowledge and experience within a particular field, such as Agile, DevOps, Data and AI, Cloud, Software Technology, Functional Programming, Intelligent Automation, and Microsoft.

We help the world‚Äôs top 250+ companies and category leaders overcome digital challenges, embrace innovation, adopt new technology, and implement new business models. In addition to high-quality consulting, we also provide offshoring and nearshoring services.

For more details, please visit www.xebia.com




Job Description




‚Ä¢ Work with data scientists, analysts, engineers and product management to

implement enhancements, develop new features and work through business

requirements into our data science and analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Deliver on a wide spectrum of data-related tasks, ranging from reporting and

analytics requests, to the implementation and analysis of machine learning

models

‚Ä¢ Develop good quality code that is easily scaled and automated

‚Ä¢ Work alongside engineers to ensure seamless integration of your work with tools

that are live in a production environment




Example Projects




Besides driving the transformation into a data-driven enterprise in general, here

are some specific projects you will work on and contribute to:

‚Ä¢ Pricing and Promotion recommendation tools

‚Ä¢ Pricing elasticity modeling




About You




‚Ä¢ University or advanced degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics,

or a related field

‚Ä¢ 4+ years' experience developing data science and analytics solutions in a

business setting

‚Ä¢ Experience with regression, linear/non-linear optimization, classification and

segmentation problems

‚Ä¢ Strong Python skills required, especially with Pandas, common machine learning

libraries and PySpark

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills

‚Ä¢ Solid analytical skills, ability to derive conclusions and questions from data

patterns

‚Ä¢ Efficient with git and Github.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Google Cloud (GCP), Docker and orchestration tools is a plus

‚Ä¢ Experience using visualization tools like Tableau or Looker Studio is a plus

‚Ä¢ Understanding of basic software engineering best practices to write reusable

code that can easily go into production

‚Ä¢ Team player, always willing to support your colleagues to the best of your ability

‚Ä¢ Proactive mindset towards problem-solving, a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude is expected







Xebia is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.

Description:
Descripci√≥n

¬°En Herbetec de Ramonete te estamos buscando!

¬øQui√©nes somos?

En Grupo Enhol llevamos m√°s de nueve d√©cadas imaginando formas de generar un impacto positivo que perdure. Title: Un/a T√®cnic/a de comunicaci√≥ cient√≠fica-√Ärea de Participaci√≥ del Pacient en Recerca
Company: Fundaci√≥ de Recerca Sant Joan de D√©u
Description:
The Patient Engagement in Research Area at the Sant Joan de D√©u Foundation is looking for a professional to manage the communication tasks of the Share4Rare platform (www.share4rare.org) as well as other projects related to science communication.

Share4Rare is an online platform that brings together a patient community and various research projects focused on rare diseases. These projects are based on the donation of medical and quality-of-life information by adult patients and caregivers of children living with a rare disease. Share4Rare offers services to researchers interested in conducting collaborative research initiatives with patients and families at both national and international levels, enabling research into a group of diseases characterized by low prevalence.

The communication activities of the Area include: management of social media, creation of blog posts and news content, design of outreach materials, reporting on research project results, and the scientific management and editing of the podcast "La Ciencia de lo Singular‚Äù, among other actions.

We are looking for a dynamic individual to join an interdisciplinary team involved in numerous internal, national, and international projects. We offer ongoing training opportunities.

Main Responsabilities


Creation of content for different types of outreach materials and in various formats: blog articles, video and podcast scripts, brochures, posters, newsletters, presentations, social media, etc.
Creation, review, and editing of educational content related to the institution‚Äôs research.
Management and updating of the website, social media, and other platforms with relevant content.
Independent visual layout design for generating presentations, graphics for social media, and other visual materials.
Analysis of website and social media metrics.
Coordination of the department‚Äôs communication and facilitation of interaction and information flow with the communication teams of IRSJD and HSJD.
Support in organizing events, talks, and conferences.
Preparation, planning, and conducting of interviews.



Requirements:

Requeriments


Academic background in communication and/or scientific fields.
Excellent writing skills and ability to create engaging, accurate, and relevant content.
Ability to adapt tone and style according to the target audience and communication channels.
Strong analytical and synthesis skills.
Initiative, autonomy, and proactivity.
Creativity and innovation in developing new formats.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Teamwork skills and ability to collaborate with different departments within the institution.
Basic knowledge of SEO and email marketing campaigns; experience with Mailchimp.
Experience using Canva for design tasks.
Proficiency in social media management platforms such as Notion and Metricool.
Experience with content management systems (CMS): Drupal.
High level of English proficiency.



What we offer


Full-time position within a young, dynamic team in a high-level scientific environment (37,5 H/week)
Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work
Flexible compensation program (including meal vouchers, health insurance, transport, and more)
Corporate benefits platform offering significant discounts on travel, culture, technology, gastronomy, sports, and many other areas
Individual development plans with access to specific training opportunities to support professional career growth

Title: Coach per la crescita autodeterminata
Place: Tabernes de Valldigna, Valencian Community, Spain
Description:
Descrizione del lavoro: Coach per la crescita autodeterminata (m/f/d)

Sede: Taverne

Orario di lavoro: Tempo pieno / Tempo parziale

Chi siamo:

Siamo un'azienda dinamica con la missione di accompagnare le persone verso un futuro sicuro e appagante. Il nostro focus √® la consulenza individuale nei settori della previdenza (3a/3b), del coaching e dello sviluppo di carriera. Se hai passione per aiutare gli altri e desideri crescere in un ambiente stimolante, sei nel posto giusto!

Le tue responsabilit√†:


Consulenza previdenziale: analizzi i bisogni individuali dei tuoi clienti e sviluppi soluzioni su misura focalizzandoti sui modelli 3a e 3b.
Coaching: aiuti i clienti a definire e raggiungere i loro obiettivi personali e professionali con metodi mirati.
Sviluppo di carriera: accompagni i clienti nel loro percorso professionale offrendo strategie concrete e suggerendo opportunit√† formative.
Costruzione di relazioni: crei fiducia a lungo termine e costruisci una rete di clienti soddisfatti.



Il tuo profilo:


Sei un/una professionista motivato/a, anche senza esperienza nel settore finanziario o del coaching.
Hai ottime competenze sociali e sai entrare in empatia con le persone.
Hai voglia di imparare e di crescere personalmente e professionalmente.
Sai riconoscere i bisogni individuali e comunicare con chiarezza.
Il lavoro di squadra e la comunicazione aperta sono per te fondamentali.



Offriamo:


Un ambiente di lavoro ispirante che promuove creativit√† e autonomia.
Formazione iniziale e aggiornamento continuo.
Orari flessibili e possibilit√† di lavoro da remoto.
Un team motivato che ti sostiene e cresce con te.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
At SGS, we are the world's leading testing, inspection, and certification company, setting the global benchmark for sustainability, quality, and integrity. With a network of 2,650 offices and laboratories and a dedicated team of 97.000 employees, we work together to create a better, safer, and more interconnected world.





Job Description



Our Digital Builders Organization is an internal team supporting the entire SGS business. Its objective is to drive new IT solutions based on SGS Business Units needs and requests, allowing the company to optimize its processes, improve its results and generate value for its clients.These IT solutions are developed through a key work methodology based on an agile approach, hybrid teams and short time to market.



As a Data Scientist, you must be able to convert in reality the business requirements related to our digital transformation where cloud technology is a key enabler. You will be working in the implementation of data MVPs as part of a Digital Builders Organization squad.



More Specifically, You Will



Collaborate with Business Units to have a deep understanding of the business problem that AI and Machine Learning may solve.
Provide technical expertise in the use cases execution, collaborating with IT to achieve optimal solutions.
Support the Product Owner in defining the scope and measurable metrics to evaluate the results of the solution to be built.
Work with architects to move from the scope of the MVP to the final picture in terms of data.
Take ownership of the AI/ML and data components in the MVPs implementation to develop rapid data solutions that address user needs.
Work closely with data owners to leverage data to build products.
Ownership of the projects you will be involved.
Promote internally and externally the work performed by the DBO Data Team to facilitate discovery of new use cases where to apply AI/ML technologies.


Qualifications


+ 6 years of professional experience in developing AI/ML solutions; experience applied to business problems;
Educated to degree level in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, Engineering or Statistics, or equivalent experience in a professional setting.
Python programming with focus on Machine Learning applied to prediction, NLP, Computer Vision and/ or Generative AI (must). Other programming languages and platforms will be valued;
MLOps/ DevOps;
Statistical knowledge is a plus;
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics;
Project management skills or certifications (Scrum Master, PMI, Lean) is a plus;
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities;
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment;
Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization;
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively;
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively ‚Äì both verbally and in writing ‚Äì in English and the local office language(s)


Additional Information



Why SGS?



Global and very stable company, world leader in the TIC (Testing, Inspection and Certification) industry.
Flexible schedule and hybrid/remote work model.
SGS university and Campus for continuous learning options.
Multinational environment where you will work with colleagues from multiple continents.
Benefits platform.

Join Us: At SGS, we are committed to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential. Apply now to be part of our motivated and dynamic team!



Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About ThetaRay:

ThetaRay is a trailblazer in AI-powered Anti-Money Laundering (AML) solutions, offering cutting-edge technology to fintechs, banks, and regulatory bodies worldwide. Our mission is to enhance trust in financial transactions, ensuring compliant and innovative business growth.

Our technology empowers customers to expand into new markets and introduce groundbreaking products.

Thetaray is a culture-driven company. Our values are at the heart of our success. By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to embody these values and inspire others through your actions.

ThetaRay is looking for a Data Scientist for customer-facing projects that combine data science with deep knowledge and understanding of machine learning and big data technologies to create solutions for customers‚Äô challenges and needs, defining and developing appropriate technical and business solutions. The Data Scientist will work closely with ThetaRay‚Äôs Product Management, Algorithm, Engineering, and Customer Success teams and lead external partners to successful implementations of the ThetaRay platform and solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Deliver successful deployment and Pilots
Manage and design the Customer-specific technical solution throughout the project life cycle
Technical leadership of Data Science and engineering aspects and team members including partners
Work on various data sources and apply sophisticated feature engineering capabilities
Bring and use business knowledge
Extract insights and actionable recommendations from large volumes of data and Investigate anomalies in Big Data
Build and manage technical relationships with customers and partners
Provide product requirements input to the Product Management team
Train the customers on the system ‚Äì system usage and monitoring aspects
Travel to customer locations both domestically and abroad


Requirements:


2+ years of experience as a data scientist/data engineer/big-data developer
BSc or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or another related field
Must have proven professional experience in data analytics for financial services with strong data mining and forensic skills
Experience working with customers - an advantage
Must have Hands-on experience and knowledge of scripting languages: Python/PySpark as well as DS workflow management tools including MLflow, Airflow, etc.
Experience in NLP or Graph Algorithms - an advantage
Working experience with Linux OS - an advantage
Fluent English - written and spoken


Core Competencies


Able to solve tech problems for customers; improvise; cope with unexpected challenges
Able to drive relevant internal functions to deliver/solve a problem for customers/partners
A motivated, self-starter who can demonstrate high analytical and technical skills
Ability to design creative solutions for complex requirements
Ability to learn and lead projects independently, and to work with minimal supervision with customers (tech & business)
Strong interpersonal relationship building
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines

Title: Researcher - Renewable Energy
Description:
About IDENER.AI

We are a team of engineers, scientists, and software developers exploring the potential of AI to tackle challenging problems in science and engineering. We use a broad interpretation of AI that merges machine learning, system modelling, advanced control, and mathematical optimization to do this. With this, we aim to create new, better, and sustainable technologies and business models to contribute to human development ultimately.

You can take a look to our projects, values and recent news at: https://idener.ai/ üëáüí•

Responsibilities

As a Researcher in our team, you will be responsible for conducting high-level research and development to drive innovation in the field of renewable energy.


Conduct experiments and analyze data from renewable energy sources including wind, hydro, solar, and bioenergy, as well as thermal management simulations across these systems.
Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team to design and develop new renewable energy systems that may include wind turbines, solar panels, hydroelectric generators, and bioenergy converters.
Simulate and model various renewable energy farms and facilities, such as wind farms, hydroelectric dams, and biomass plants, to create digital twins and control tools for real-time system management.
Implement Artificial Intelligence-based forecasting methods to improve the reliability of renewable energy sources by transitioning from predictive to preventive maintenance strategies across different technologies.
Perform data analysis to evaluate the performance of various renewable energy components and systems, looking at factors such as efficiency, output, and environmental impact.
Manage large-scale data from multiple renewable energy sources for real-time analysis through efficient cloud deployment to optimize grid performance and energy distribution.
Keep up to date with the latest developments in renewable energy research, including advancements in energy storage, grid integration, and smart technology, and incorporate new findings into project work.
Work independently and proactively to achieve research objectives in the field of renewable energy, ensuring that projects are innovative and contribute to the advancement of sustainable technologies.
Engage with partners and stakeholders across Europe and globally to advance project goals and promote the adoption of renewable energy solutions, while considering regulatory, environmental, and social impacts.


Why Join Us?

In addition to the opportunity for long-term professional development in a dynamic and challenging environment, we offer a positive work atmosphere focusing on work-life balance.


Competitive Salary.
Be at the forefront of scientific innovation with cutting-edge technology and tools
Work in a stimulating and collaborative international environment.
Contribute to projects that could revolutionize industries.
Total flexible hours.
Hybrid work.


Minimum Requirements

Required Education


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering (Industrial, Electrical, Mechanical, Renewable Energy, or related field).
Other relevant backgrounds may include degrees in Physics, Applied Mathematics, Environmental Science, or Materials Science, with a strong focus on thermodynamics, energy systems, or renewable energy.


Must-Have


English Level: Minimum B2 proficiency.
Proactive Research Approach: A proactive attitude towards research and problem-solving is essential.
Autonomy: Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Analytical and Critical Thinking: Strong analytical and critical thinking skills are a must.
Communication Skills: Proficiency in both written and spoken is essential.
Willingness to Travel: Willingness to travel within Europe for research projects and collaborations.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

What We Offer


You will have the opportunity to collaborate with Data Scientists and other data professionals, gaining valuable experience and insights from working closely with experts in the field.
Interact with our clients on a regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


As a Data Science Analyst, you are responsible for turning our clients‚Äô business a more data-driven one, where data is used to drive action in every team, every day.
Solve Data Science and Analytics problems that we face at clients. ‚ÄØ
Perform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Prepare and facilitating workshops.
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives.



Enjoy the rich knowledge sharing environment of Strategists, Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists.

What You Will Bring


1‚Äì3 years of experience in analytics or data-driven roles.
Advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Engineering, Mathematics, Economics).
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to break down complex problems and generate data-driven insights.
Proficiency in SQL and programming languages such as Python, R or Matlab.
Solid knowledge of statistics, machine learning, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Shiny).
Comfortable communicating in the language of data, statistics, finance, and economics.
Intellectual curiosity and a strong decision-making ability based on data and theoretical frameworks.
Fluency in English and Spanish (spoken and written).
